thread.title: Bethlehem takes title in tennis
thread.title_full: Bethlehem takes title in tennis - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Bethlehem takes title in tennis
text:
Photo: Cindy Schultz Image 1 of / 2 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 2 Buy photo Bethlehem's Emma DeFrancesco returns the ball during Section II tennis team championships against Shaker's Haejin Lee on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, at Central Park in Schenectady, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Bethlehem's Emma DeFrancesco returns the ball during Section II tennis team championships against Shaker's Haejin Lee on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, at Central Park in Schenectady, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Photo: Cindy Schultz Buy this photo Image 2 of 2 Buy photo Shaker's Haejin Lee returns the ball during Section II tennis team championships against Bethlehem's Emma DeFrancesco on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, at Central Park in Schenectady, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Shaker's Haejin Lee returns the ball during Section II tennis team championships against Bethlehem's Emma DeFrancesco on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, at Central Park in Schenectady, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Photo: Cindy Schultz Buy this photo Bethlehem takes title in tennis 1 / 2 Back to Gallery Bethlehem clinched its first section title in girls' tennis since 2010 when Bethy Behuniak beat Keanna Cruz , 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the fourth singles match to give the Eagles a 5-4 win over Shaker.
The Eagles (20-0) won all three doubles matches and two singles matches, including Behuniak's match. It was the third time this season Behuniak has gone to three sets to clinch a win.
"She's our marathon girl. This is familiar territory for her," Bethlehem coach Scott George said. "She has a knack for playing these long grueling matches."
Boys' soccer: Shane Wenz scored two goals to lead second-seeded Ichabod Crane past Mechanicville, 4-0, in a Class B first-round game at Ichabod Crane. Nick Johnston and Nick Gallo had the other goals for the Riders, who advance to play seventh-seeded Catskill on Monday in the quarterfinal round. ... Schalmont rolled to an 8-0 win over Fonda in another Class B contest. Cameron LaVallee scored three goals and had an assist and Chris Hamilton added two goals and three assists to lead the Sabres' attack. ... Top-seeded Maple Hill shut out Berne-Knox, 3-0, in a Class C quarterfinal. Garrett Axtmann and Cole Cioffi both had a goal and an assist to lead the Wildcats . ... Columbia advanced to the Class AA quarterfinals after Guilderland scored an own goal in the first half. Nick Nadareski made six saves for the Blue Devils . Jared Rubin made three saves for the Dutchmen. ... Konstantinos Tsitos scored two goals to lead No. 4 Saratoga Springs past No. 13 La Salle, 5-0, in a Class AA boys' soccer playoff game in Saratoga Springs. Tsitos scored 10 seconds into the game on a cross from Matt LaRosa . He gave the Blue Streaks a 3-0 lead later in the half when he scored on a shot from the box after Jake Milstein sent a pass to the far post. Stephen Klimek scored on a penalty kick in the 39th minute and Simon Smith converted another penalty kick in the 69th minute to cap the scoring. The Blue Streaks (12-3-1) outshot the Cadets 16-2 and held a 2-1 advantage in corner kicks. Tyler Rapp made 11 saves for La Salle (10-7). Hunter Choy and Duncan Moller combined to earn the shutout in net for Saratoga Springs.
Girls' soccer: Dora Hayes and Amanda Lobban scored goals to lift Columbia over Ballston Spa, 2-1, in a Class AA first round contest. Columbia moves on to take on top-seeded Shenendehowa on Monday at 7 p.m. in the quarterfinals. ... Taylor Mann scored in the final round of penalty kicks to give No. 6 Hoosick Falls a 2-1 win over No. 11 Chatham in a Class B first-round game. Ashley Foster scored in the first half to give the Panthers (14-3) a 1-0 lead. Taylor Hansen tied the game in the second half.
